hero.title: Let's automate clinical research!
hero.subtitle: Let's give everyone their own personal FDA AI agent to autonomously discover the positive and negative effects of every food and drug in the world!

option1.label: Option 1.
option1.text: Wait decades for the current system to maybe find cures

option2.label: Option 2.
option2.text: Help us automate clinical research and accelerate discovery

whySuffer.title: 2 Billion People are SUFFERING
whySuffer.description: from chronic diseases like depression, fibromyalgia, Crohn's disease, and multiple sclerosis. There are over 7000 diseases that we still don't have cures for.
whySuffer.chartTitle: Since the 1990's, we've seen a continual rise in the incidence of Chronic Diseases

chemicals.title: The ONLY thing that has changed is the
chemicals.subtitle: chemicals in your food

goodNews.title: Good News!
goodNews.text: There could be billions of cures we don't even know about yet!
goodNews.description: Of the 166 billion potential medicinal molecules, we've only tested 0.00001%. That means we've barely scratched the surface of potential treatments.

slowResearch.title: Unfortunately, Clinical Research is SLOW, EXPENSIVE, and IMPRECISE
stats: It costs about $2.6 billion and takes about 12 years to bring a new drug to market
We only approve around 30 drugs a year
It would take over 350 years to find all the cures at this rate!
So, you'll be long dead by then.
slowResearch.failureRate: 80% of Clinical Trials Fail Due to Insufficient Participants

participation.subtitle: Less than 1% of People with Chronic Diseases Participate in Clinical Research

death.question: So should we just wait for the sweet release of death?

robots.answer: NO! We can fix it with the power of robots!
robots.vision: But imagine if we could automate clinical research!

costSavings.title: The cost savings from automating clinical research could make the next part of that chart look like this:
costSavings.savingsText: By eliminating 90% of the cost of clinical research, we could save $360 billion annually in healthcare costs through preventative care discoveries.

methods.name: Import from Wearables and Apps
methods.description: It should be effortless for patients to import their data from lots of apps and wearable devices like physical activity, sleep, environmental factors, and vital signs.

methods.name: Browser AI Agents
methods.description: Patients should be able to use browser-based autonomous AI agents to collect their diet data from services like Instacart, supplement purchases from Amazon, CVS prescriptions, Quest lab results, etc.

methods.name: Manual Data Collection
methods.description: Patients should be able to easily record any symptom severities, foods, treatments, or anything in a simple reminder inbox.

methods.name: Data from Speech
methods.description: Patients who prefer talking over messing around with apps should be able to talk to the FDAi. This would also allow passive inference of cognitive and emotional data.

methods.name: Images to Data
methods.description: Patients should be able to easily record any symptom severities, foods, treatments, or anything in a simple reminder inbox.

methods.name: Notifications
methods.description: Patients should be able to use web and mobile notifications with action buttons can be used to track symptoms and factors in a fraction of a second.

automatedDataAnalysis.title: 2. Automated Data Analysis
automatedDataAnalysis.description: Automated analysis of collected data to identify patterns and correlations

automatedCausalInference.title: Automated Causal Inference
automatedCausalInference.description: Advanced causal inference algorithms to determine cause-and-effect relationships

personalStudies.title: Personal Studies
personalStudies.description: For instance, when gluten-sensitive people eat delicious gluten, it usually takes about a 2-day onset delay before they start having symptoms. Then, when they stop eating it, there's usually a 10-day duration of action before their gut heals and their symptoms improve.

onsetDelays.title: Onset Delays
onsetDelays.description: One example of causal inference involves applying forward and reverse lagging of the depression and exercise data. The result suggests a causal relationship based on the temporal precedence of physical activity.

durationOfAction.title: Duration of Action
durationOfAction.description: Understanding how long effects last after treatment or exposure

steps.title: Trial Search
steps.description: If you're one of the inadequately treated 2 billion chronically ill and nothing else has worked for you, it should find you the most promising new treatment available.

steps.title: Trial Enrollment
steps.description: If you want to participate, it should automatically enroll you and get the treatment shipped to you or whatever.

steps.title: Data Collection
steps.description: The FDAi should automatically schedule all the tests and collect all the data to determine the safety and efficacy of the treatment.

steps.title: Data Analysis and Publishing
steps.description: The FDAi should then analyze and anonymize the data and publish the results for everyone.

megaStudies.title: Mega-Studies
megaStudies.description: should allow anyone to look up their condition and see how different foods, drugs and supplements tend to improve or worsen their condition for the average person.

outcomeLabels.title: Outcome Labels
outcomeLabels.description: should be available for all foods and drugs that tell us precisely how they'll affect us instead of just how much Riboflavin is in them.

citizenScience.title: Citizen Science
citizenScience.description: Anyone should be able to create a study, become a prestigious scientist, get a link, and invite all their friends to join!

globalScaleStudies.title: Global Scale Studies
globalScaleStudies.description: should be published in a Wikipedia for clinical research based on everyone's data listing the likely effects of every food and drug.

fdaiAct.title: Show Your Support for the FDAi Act!
fdaiAct.description: We want the FDA to give everyone a free super-intelligent doctor to automate clinical research and maximize universal health and happiness!
